description: The ability to image RNA identity and location with nanoscale precision in intact tissues is of great interest for defining cell types and states in normal and pathological biological settings. Here, we present a strategy for expansion microscopy of RNA. We developed a small-molecule linker that enables RNA to be covalently attached to a swellable polyelectrolyte gel synthesized throughout a biological specimen. Then, postexpansion, fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) imaging of RNA can be performed with high yield and specificity as well as single-molecule precision in both cultured cells and intact brain tissue. Expansion FISH (ExFISH) separates RNAs and supports amplification of single-molecule signals (i.e., via hybridization chain reaction) as well as multiplexed RNA FISH readout. ExFISH thus enables super-resolution imaging of RNA structure and location with diffraction-limited microscopes in thick specimens, such as intact brain tissue and other tissues of importance to biology and medicine.
before_start:
*Sodium Acrylate, purity note: check for yellow color upon resuspension: that indicates poor quality; solution should be clear (see http://expansionmicroscopy.org)

 

Stock solutions: 

 

MOPS Buffer: 20 mM MOPS pH 7.7

  • For conveniently adjusting the final volume, prepare the MOPS buffer at 10 times the final concentration (i.e. 200mM MOPS pH 7.7). When diluting LabelX in the MOPS buffer add nuclease-free water to bring the final concentration of the buffer to 20 mM MOPS pH 7.7.

 

Hybridization Buffer for smFISH: 10% (w/v) dextran sulfate, 10% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Prepare the hybridization buffer without formamide and store it at 4°C. Add formamide right before performing FISH.

 

Hybridization Buffer for HCR-FISH: 10% (w/v) dextran sulfate, 20% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Prepare the hybridization buffer without formamide and store it at 4°C. Add formamide right before FISH.

 

Wash Buffer for smFISH (WA-10): 10% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Can be stored at room temperature for up to a week.

 

Wash Buffer for HCR-FISH (WA-20): 20% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Can be stored at room temperature for up to a week.

 

5x SSCT: 5x SSC, 0.1% Tween-20

  • Can be stored at room temperature.

 

0.05x SSCT: 0.05x SSC, 0.1% Tween-20

  • Can be stored at room temperature.

 

Amplification buffer: 5x SSC, 10% (w/v) dextran sulfate, 0.1% Tween-20

  • Store at 4°C.

 

Digestion Buffer: 50 mM Tris pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5% Triton X-100, 1M NaCl

  • Can be stored at room temperature.

  • Add Proteinase K (NEB, 1:100, final concentration 8 units/mL) to digestion buffer before use.
warning: Please refer to the SDS (Saftey Data Sheet) for safety warnings and hazard information.
protocol_affiliation: Massachusetts Institute of Technology,University of Pennsylvania,Harvard University
manuscript_citation: Chen F. (2016). Nanoscale imaging of RNA with expansion microscopy. Nature Methods13, 679–684 (2016) doi: 10.1038/nmeth.3899

groups.group_name: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

keywords: Fluorescence imaging, Fluorescence in situ hybridization, Molecular neuroscience, Super-resolution microscopy

collections.protocol_name: ExFISH Protocols For Cells and Tissues
collections.protocol_name_html: ExFISH Protocols For Cells and Tissues

authors: Fei Chen,Asmamaw T Wassie,Allison J Cote,Anubhav Sinha,Shahar Alon,Shoh Asano,Evan R Daugharthy,Jae-Byum Chang,Adam Marblestone,George M Church,Arjun Raj,Edward S Boyden
guidelines:
Preparation of LabelX:

  • Label-IT amine nucleic acid labeling reagent purchased from Mirus Bio.: https://www.mirusbio.com/products/labeling/label-it-nucleic-acid-modifying-reagent

  • Resuspend Label-IT amine at 1 mg/mL using the provided resuspension buffer. Add the resuspension buffer and vortex to mix.

  • Resuspend acryloyl X SE (AcX) (https://www.lifetechnologies.com/order/catalog/product/A20770) in 500 µL anhydrous DMSO (10 mg/mL stock solution). Aliquot in 20 µL and store desiccated at -20°C.

  • React the Label-IT to AcX at equal mass ratio. For example, add 1 µL of acryloyl X to 10 µL of Label-IT (both are resuspended in DMSO so the reaction is carried out in DMSO). React for >6 hrs at room temperature on benchtop shaker. Store the LabelX at -20°C with desiccant for future use.

components.data: Transcardially perfuse with 1xPBS (5-10 mL) followed by 4% paraformaldehyde in 1xPBS (~30 mL).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transcardially perfuse with 1xPBS (5-10 mL) followed by 4% paraformaldehyde in 1xPBS (~30 mL).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Perfusion and Slicing are essentially the same as conventional histology.
source_data.thread_text: Perfusion and Slicing are essentially the same as conventional histology.
source_data.body: Perfusion and Slicing are essentially the same as conventional histology.

source_data.description: Post-fix the brain in 4% paraformaldehyde overnight.
Wash with 1x PBS before cutting slices.

components.data: Cut brain slices on a vibratome (can cut 50 - 300 micron slices).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut brain slices on a vibratome (can cut 50 - 300 micron slices).

components.data:
Store slices in 1x PBS if they are used immediately (1-2 days), or store in 70%
ethanol for longer times for improved RNA stability at 4 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Store slices in 1x PBS if they are used immediately (1-2 days), or store in 70%
ethanol for longer times for improved RNA stability at 4 °C.

components.data: If slices were stored in ethanol, rehydrate slices permeabilized with 70% ethanol by washing twice with 1x PBS for 15 minutes per wash at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If slices were stored in ethanol, rehydrate slices permeabilized with 70% ethanol by washing twice with 1x PBS for 15 minutes per wash at room temperature.

components.data: Pre-incubate slices with MOPS buffer for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pre-incubate slices with MOPS buffer for 30 minutes.

components.data: Prepare LabelX by diluting in MOPS buffer at 0.1 mg/mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare LabelX by diluting in MOPS buffer at 0.1 mg/mL.

components.data:
Remove the preincubation MOPS buffer and add to the cultured cells LabelX in MOPS
buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove the preincubation MOPS buffer and add to the cultured cells LabelX in MOPS
buffer.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 9 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: We like to process our tissue in 24 well or 48 well plates. (Use enough volume to cover the slices, for example in a 24 well plate, 4 sections can be incubated in 250 µL solution.)
source_data.thread_text: We like to process our tissue in 24 well or 48 well plates. (Use enough volume to cover the slices, for example in a 24 well plate, 4 sections can be incubated in 250 µL solution.)
source_data.body: We like to process our tissue in 24 well or 48 well plates. (Use enough volume to cover the slices, for example in a 24 well plate, 4 sections can be incubated in 250 µL solution.)

components.data: Incubate slices with LabelX in MOPS overnight at 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate slices with LabelX in MOPS overnight at 37°C.
Wash slices with 1x PBS for 5 minutes. (1/2)
Wash slices with 1x PBS for 5 minutes. (2/2)

components.data: Proceed to gelation and digestion as described in the “ExM Slice Protocol.”
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Proceed to gelation and digestion as described in the “ExM Slice Protocol.”

components.data: Make sure to remove excess PBS from brain slices before incubation with gelling solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make sure to remove excess PBS from brain slices before incubation with gelling solution.

components.data: Incubate slices in gelling solution in an Eppendorf tube for 5 mins at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate slices in gelling solution in an Eppendorf tube for 5 mins at 4°C.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 15 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Use freshly prepared gelling solution, immediately after adding APS at 4°C. (Make sure at least 100-fold excess volume of monomer solution is used. E.g., ~200µl of gelling solution for each brain slice. Need ~100µl for each of two incubations.)
source_data.thread_text: Use freshly prepared gelling solution, immediately after adding APS at 4°C. (Make sure at least 100-fold excess volume of monomer solution is used. E.g., ~200µl of gelling solution for each brain slice. Need ~100µl for each of two incubations.)
source_data.body: Use freshly prepared gelling solution, immediately after adding APS at 4°C. (Make sure at least 100-fold excess volume of monomer solution is used. E.g., ~200µl of gelling solution for each brain slice. Need ~100µl for each of two incubations.)

components.data: Replace the gelling solution with new gelling solution and incubate for another 25 mins at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Replace the gelling solution with new gelling solution and incubate for another 25 mins at 4°C.

components.data: Transfer slices from Eppendorf tube into a gel chamber and then incubate at 37°C for 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer slices from Eppendorf tube into a gel chamber and then incubate at 37°C for 2 hours.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 17 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Gel chambers are constructed by sandwiching the slice between a slide and a coverglass, with spacers on either side of the tissue section to prevent compression of tissue slice (see schematic below). For 30 and 100 µm sections, pieces of #1 coverglass were used for spacers and for 200 µm sections, pieces of # 1 coverglasses can be stacked two coverglasses thick. (Spacers are easy to make from full coverglasses with a diamond scribe.) Make sure the slices are flat, and avoid air bubbles trapped inside the chamber.
source_data.thread_text: Gel chambers are constructed by sandwiching the slice between a slide and a coverglass, with spacers on either side of the tissue section to prevent compression of tissue slice (see schematic below). For 30 and 100 µm sections, pieces of #1 coverglass were used for spacers and for 200 µm sections, pieces of # 1 coverglasses can be stacked two coverglasses thick. (Spacers are easy to make from full coverglasses with a diamond scribe.) Make sure the slices are flat, and avoid air bubbles trapped inside the chamber.
source_data.body: Gel chambers are constructed by sandwiching the slice between a slide and a coverglass, with spacers on either side of the tissue section to prevent compression of tissue slice (see schematic below). For 30 and 100 µm sections, pieces of #1 coverglass were used for spacers and for 200 µm sections, pieces of # 1 coverglasses can be stacked two coverglasses thick. (Spacers are easy to make from full coverglasses with a diamond scribe.) Make sure the slices are flat, and avoid air bubbles trapped inside the chamber.

components.data: Take off the cover of the gel chamber, and submerge it in digesting buffer, overnight at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take off the cover of the gel chamber, and submerge it in digesting buffer, overnight at room temperature.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 18 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: (Make sure at least 10-fold excess volume of digestion buffer is used, and make sure to completely submerge the slice; make sure it does not dry out.) A small slide box, or a plastic well can be used to incubate the gel and digestion buffer.
source_data.thread_text: (Make sure at least 10-fold excess volume of digestion buffer is used, and make sure to completely submerge the slice; make sure it does not dry out.) A small slide box, or a plastic well can be used to incubate the gel and digestion buffer.
source_data.body: (Make sure at least 10-fold excess volume of digestion buffer is used, and make sure to completely submerge the slice; make sure it does not dry out.) A small slide box, or a plastic well can be used to incubate the gel and digestion buffer.

components.data: Wash slices with excess volume of ddH2O (we usually use at least 10x the final gel volume), 3-5 times, for 15mins each time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash slices with excess volume of ddH2O (we usually use at least 10x the final gel volume), 3-5 times, for 15mins each time.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 19 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Slice expansion reaches plateau after about the 3 rd or 4th wash. The expansion chamber needs to be of adequate size for the sample, we found that for hemislices of mouse brains, the expanded gel fits nicely in a glass bottom 6 well plate (In Vitro Scientific) when the excess gel around the brain is trimmed away (a Glass Slide Gel Chamber (side view) Top Coverglass Spacer (Coverglass #1/1.5) Brain Slice razor blade works well for this). Gels can be immobilized with 2% low melt agarose in water to prevent drift during imaging.
source_data.thread_text: Slice expansion reaches plateau after about the 3 rd or 4th wash. The expansion chamber needs to be of adequate size for the sample, we found that for hemislices of mouse brains, the expanded gel fits nicely in a glass bottom 6 well plate (In Vitro Scientific) when the excess gel around the brain is trimmed away (a Glass Slide Gel Chamber (side view) Top Coverglass Spacer (Coverglass #1/1.5) Brain Slice razor blade works well for this). Gels can be immobilized with 2% low melt agarose in water to prevent drift during imaging.
source_data.body: Slice expansion reaches plateau after about the 3 rd or 4th wash. The expansion chamber needs to be of adequate size for the sample, we found that for hemislices of mouse brains, the expanded gel fits nicely in a glass bottom 6 well plate (In Vitro Scientific) when the excess gel around the brain is trimmed away (a Glass Slide Gel Chamber (side view) Top Coverglass Spacer (Coverglass #1/1.5) Brain Slice razor blade works well for this). Gels can be immobilized with 2% low melt agarose in water to prevent drift during imaging.

components.data: After digestion, wash gels with 1x PBS for 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After digestion, wash gels with 1x PBS for 15 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 20 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Gels can be stored at 4°C after this step.
source_data.thread_text: Gels can be stored at 4°C after this step.
source_data.body: Gels can be stored at 4°C after this step.

components.data: Pre-hybridize gels by incubating with wash buffer (WA-20) for 30 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pre-hybridize gels by incubating with wash buffer (WA-20) for 30 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Prepare probes by diluting in HCR-FISH hybridization buffer at the desired concentration (~1 nM per probe). Vortex to mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare probes by diluting in HCR-FISH hybridization buffer at the desired concentration (~1 nM per probe). Vortex to mix.

components.data: Remove the wash buffer from the gels.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the wash buffer from the gels.

components.data: Add the hybridization buffer with probes onto the gels.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the hybridization buffer with probes onto the gels.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 24 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Add enough volume to completely cover the gel to be stained (for 24-well plates, 300µl).
source_data.thread_text: Add enough volume to completely cover the gel to be stained (for 24-well plates, 300µl).
source_data.body: Add enough volume to completely cover the gel to be stained (for 24-well plates, 300µl).

source_data.description: Incubate overnight (or for > 6hrs) at 37°C.

components.data: Wash gels with excess volume (eg. 500µl for 24-well plates) of WA-20 at 37°C for 30 mins. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash gels with excess volume (eg. 500µl for 24-well plates) of WA-20 at 37°C for 30 mins. (1/2)

components.data: Wash gels with excess volume of WA-20 at 37°C for 30 mins. (2/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash gels with excess volume of WA-20 at 37°C for 30 mins. (2/2)

components.data: Wash once with excess volume 1x PBS at 37°C for 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash once with excess volume 1x PBS at 37°C for 2 hours.

components.data: Wash once with excess volume of 1x PBS at RT for 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash once with excess volume of 1x PBS at RT for 2 hours.

components.data: Pre-amplify slices with amplification buffer for 30 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pre-amplify slices with amplification buffer for 30 minutes at room temperature.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 30 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: HCR amplification is adapted from: Choi et al., ACS Nano, 2014, 8 (5), pp 4284–4294, “Next generation in situ hybridization chain reaction;” see http://molecularinstruments.org
source_data.thread_text: HCR amplification is adapted from: Choi et al., ACS Nano, 2014, 8 (5), pp 4284–4294, “Next generation in situ hybridization chain reaction;” see http://molecularinstruments.org

components.data: Prepare fluorescently labeled hairpin by snap cooling each hairpin (heat at 95°C for 90 seconds and cool to room temperature on the benchtop for 30 min).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare fluorescently labeled hairpin by snap cooling each hairpin (heat at 95°C for 90 seconds and cool to room temperature on the benchtop for 30 min).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 31 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: For each 500 µL of amplification reaction, 10 µL of each hairpin is needed; we use 150 µL reactions per 48 well or 250 µL per 24 well.
source_data.thread_text: For each 500 µL of amplification reaction, 10 µL of each hairpin is needed; we use 150 µL reactions per 48 well or 250 µL per 24 well.
source_data.body: For each 500 µL of amplification reaction, 10 µL of each hairpin is needed; we use 150 µL reactions per 48 well or 250 µL per 24 well.

components.data: Prepare hairpin solution by adding all snap-cooled hairpins to amplification buffer at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare hairpin solution by adding all snap-cooled hairpins to amplification buffer at room temperature.

components.data: Remove the pre-amplification solution and add the hairpin solution to the gels.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the pre-amplification solution and add the hairpin solution to the gels.
Incubate for 2-4 hours at room temperature.
Stop amplification with 30-minute washes with 5x SSCT. (1/4)
Stop amplification with 30-minute washes with 5x SSCT. (2/4)
Stop amplification with 30-minute washes with 5x SSCT. (3/4)
Stop amplification with 30-minute washes with 5x SSCT. (4/4)

components.data: Slices can now be imaged. To expand slices, wash 3x 10 minutes with .05X SSCT (1:100 dilution of 5x SSCT).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slices can now be imaged. To expand slices, wash 3x 10 minutes with .05X SSCT (1:100 dilution of 5x SSCT).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 39 of ExFISH - Tissue Slice
source_data.annotation: Expansion factor can be tuned by salt level; imaging can also be performed in 1x PBS for ~2x expansion.
source_data.thread_text: Expansion factor can be tuned by salt level; imaging can also be performed in 1x PBS for ~2x expansion.
source_data.body: Expansion factor can be tuned by salt level; imaging can also be performed in 1x PBS for ~2x expansion.
